GEORGE, SOPHIE AND BEN PAPILLON, TAUPE, SOUXIE, ZED

SENDING BATS SHOOTING OUT FROM THE STATUE

A BLACK DUST CLOUD RUSHES PAST SCARLETT, LEAVING HER IN T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera powers up, jostles around until it settles on -- The floor of a third world bus. Middle Eastern legs, traditional Arabian dresses to the floor, homemade bags, animals everywhere. A chaotic scene with men, women, chil all shouting in Farsi. Brief glimpses of a mountainous landscape through the shaky windows. This bus could reall use some new shocks and a better muffler. The camera rises, turns around revealing its operator, a WOMAN wearing a hajib (a traditional Arabian headdress). slumps low in her seat for privacy, looks around cautious and carefully lowers her veil revealing -- SCARLETT DURANG, mid 20s, an adventurous British archaeologist. The kind of cat that gets killed by curios Her off-the-charts intellect and multiple post-grad degre are barely concealed by her striking good looks and punk inclinations. Judging from the cloth that edges frame, she is obviously shooting with a small camera attached to her hajib. She whispers to the camera - alert, but not scared.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I'm approximately 20 miles inside the Iranian border en route to the Habala region where they have ordered the destruction of a network of caves at sundown tonight. I believe these caves might contain a critical missing piece of our history. A piece I can’t let them destroy. She turns the camera back around, then pauses and goes ba to her face. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Oh, and if I’m found dead, please know I entered the country of my own free will, fully knowing the penalty for trespassing here is burial up to your neck in sand and having a rock wall pushed on top of you. Which, you know, seems perfectly appropriate. She grins mischievously.  SCARLETT (CONT’D) But they’1l have to catch me first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun is almost touching the horizon. The camera shakes as Scarlett crosses through a sparsely populated marketplace as megaphones in the background dem everyone clear the area. Scarlett is careful to keep pace with REZA, a mousy Persi with a neatly trimmed moustache and a weathered knockoff Tommy Hilfiger T-shirt. He leads her to a small, rock hut a home.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: Hurry! Come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera follows Reza into a shanty.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: If they catch you here it would be very bad for you.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know. Reza nods to his WIFE, in traditional garb. She nods back slides some sooty wooden shelves aside revealing --

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS .
dialogues.text: Scarlett smiles. She shines her mini flashlight into the hole, the ground about 10 feet down. She gets ready to climb in.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: Wait. You’1l need this. Reza grabs a homemade rope ladder that’s tied to the base the stove and drops it into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett climbs into the dark cavern. As the camera crosses the threshold it moves into near to darkness. Background sound from the streets above become faint echoes. Reza drops down right behind her. A grinding sound as Reza’s wife slides the bookshelves ba into place, obliterating the light above. Once Scarlett gets her footing, she shines her flashlight down the cave corridor. It's long and dark. It's about 4 tall, forcing Scarlett and Reza into a crouched scamper.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: We don’t have much time. They have already cleared the area. They race deeper and deeper into the cave.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAPHONE RIGHT AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: They race back and take cover behind a rock. Scarlett gra rock off the floor in case she needs to use it as a weapo An ARMED GUARD passes, calling instructions out into the megaphone. If he just looks over his shoulder, he’1l see them. But he doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: REZA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to leave. We’re too late.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: They're not blowing the caves until sundown, right? Scarlett checks her watch. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Should give us a few more minutes.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: It’s too risky.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Which way is it? I'll go without you.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m not leaving. Reza can see she’s not bluffing. And she’s not. He reluctantly continues.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: Hurry! They race through one last corridor, then arrive at their destination --

dialogues.speaker: REZA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There. Scarlett races to it - a wall full of ancient Coptic Christian inscriptions.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: (whispers ) It’s even more beautiful than the pictures. She runs her fingers through the grooves as if she’s read braille. She quietly reads aloud in an ancient tongue.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: We must hurry. Please! The camera seems to drift down, and she resets it a coupl times until--

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: How can anyone think straight with these head covers falling all She anxiously whips the veil off her head and throws it d on the floor beside her, RE-FRAMING THE CAVE IN AN AWKWAR ANGLE, CAPTURING SHE, REZA, AND THE WALL SIDEWAYS. She continues reading the inscriptions. SCARLETT (CONT’D) There’s more. She looks around frantically, grabs a rock off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: We have to go! She hacks away at the inscriptions with the rock, chiseli off chunks of stone with each hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: They're going to blow it up anyway!

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: They’1l hear you! Stop! A whistle blows in the distance. Someone shouts in Farsi.

dialogues.speaker: REZA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're going to blow it.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I just need a minute.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: We don’t have a minute! She analyzes the stone wall. Picks a specific spot marked an inscribed rose. Takes one more hit and THE WHOLE WALL COLLAPSES TO THE GROUND revealing --

dialogues.speaker: A GIANT STONE STATUE OF A BULL HOLDING A SNAKE IN ITS MOU
dialogues.text: IT’S FACE IS FIERCE, OMINOUS, CREEPY. AND IT’S COVERED WI INSCRIPTIONS. One glance at it and Scarlett knows what it is.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Do you know what this is?! It takes her a moment to snap to. Reza grabs her and physically tries to escort her away.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: We must go! Now! She pushes her way free.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I have been searching for this all my life! Go! I’1l catch up!

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I have a family. REZA RUNS OFF, LEAVING HER ALONE IN THE CAVE. Scarlett whips out a small piece of equipment the size of remote control from a small satchel hidden under her robe We hear faint voices on megaphones from down the tunnels The small scanner hums to life as it emits a solid line o green light. Scarlett begins to methodically blanket the statue with the laser, scanning it for future study.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Come on. The light creates eerie shadows of the statue on vaulted ceilings of the chamber. She's painfully slow making sure to get every detail of t ancient relic. The voices from the megaphones are getting louder and more foreboding. The voice in the megaphone seems to be doing a countdown, in the foreign language, it’s hard to tell which number i down to. Scarlett knows how close she’s cutting this, but she won’ lose this piece of history. She continues swiping the gre laser line from the scanner over every side of the bull. She's done! She grabs her headdress and runs like hell.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Scarlett keeps racing forward, hoping the sounds of collapsing rock won’t catch her. She slams into something. SCARLETT (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: Something moves. Sunlight cracks through the dust. The ro ladder drops. Scarlett climbs into the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And back into Reza’s house. She collapses on the ground, coughing furiously. She holds up the scanner.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I got it. I got it. She keeps coughing as Reza shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: REZA
dialogues.text: You remind me so much of your father. But you must be more careful. His quest was a path to madness.

dialogues.speaker: CUT OUT
dialogues.text: Note: The following Kickstarter video will be more “produ than the rest of the film - full of B-Roll, even music, glossy - a real presentational video. INT. SCARLETT’S OFFICE - UNIVERSITY COLLEGE LONDON Scarlett, now in her “street clothes” has a punk-rock hip that’s hard to deny. She looks directly into the camera a talks.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Hello Kickstarter. My name is Scarlett Durang, and I may have just discovered the key to immortal life. INT. SCARLETT’S OFFICE - DAY BENJI DONAGHAN, late 20s, a friendly, slightly heavy red Irishman. The devilish glint in his eyes reminds us of th rascally friend we all like to drink with when we need a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: I’m Benji Donaghan. For those of you who’ve seen my previous documentaries like LONER or BROTHER IN ARMS, you know I am fascinated with obsessive personality types.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I’m a professor of archaeology at University College London. I have a PhD in Egyptology. A masters in chemistry and another PhD in linguistics. I am fluent in four spoken languages, and two dead ones. (she smiles) And I'm a blackbelt in Krav Maga.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: I have yet to see her do anything. Literally anything at all that isn’t driven by her all-consuming quest to find the lost knowledge of the alchemists.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: What is alchemy? She smiles. This is a big question. A montage of imagery: Alchemists, arcane symbols, representations of the Philosopher's Stone and the proces used to create it play over the following.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Alchemy was an early form of science in which the practitioners attempted to create a mythical substance known as the Philosopher's Stone, which could turn base metals to gold, cure disease and provide the key to eternal life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett points to the house behind her.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: 600 years ago, the greatest of the alchemists, Nicolas Flamel, lived in this house in Paris. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was widely believed to have succeeded in developing the Philosopher’s Stone, which would have given him all the wealth he could dream of as well as eternal life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagery of Flamel’s life done in the old style of woodcut

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Though we don’t have definitive proof of this, we do know that he was a middle class book dealer who suddenly became one of the wealthiest men in Paris... Present day footage of buildings his money built. SCARLETT (CONT’D) ...-donating orphanages and hospitals all over the city, many of which still stand today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Scarlett.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: In fact, he was so generous with this money, that 600 years later, this street in Paris is still named after him. The camera pans off her to the sign “Rue Nicolas Flamel” beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett now stands near the Fontaine des Innocents - the last remnant of Paris’ original cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: We also know that when grave robbers, hoping to get their hands on the Philosopher’s Stone, tried to dig his body up out of a cemetery that used to surround this spot here, they found his casket empty. As well as his wife’s.
Scarlett stands in front of an archaeological exhibit ina Parisian museum.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: And we know that 400 years later, an archeologist working for King Louis XV met an old man in Turkey who knew things he believed only Nicolas Flamel could have known. He was convinced to his dying day that this man had been Flamel himself. INT. SCARLETT’S OFFICE - DAY Again, Scarlett sits in her office talking to camera, tho she seems uncomfortable with the question asked of her.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I... came from a studious household, I guess. When I was 7, my mother died suddenly and... we took it really hard. My dad dropped everything to search for the key to everlasting life. And I went with him. Everywhere. Benji speaks to camera.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Her father was a Nobel Laureate! When he dropped out and went searching for Nicolas Flamel’s discovery, it was the scandal of academia. Everyone chalked it off to madness. Scarlett talks.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: No, he wasn’t crazy. He just believed that some things in this universe aren’t wired together as simply as modern science might suggest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benji speaks.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: After spending 20 years chasing clues, her father took his own life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett stands in front of a glass case holding a GRAVES COVERED IN SYMBOLS at the Musee de Cluny.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: This was Flamel’s gravestone, which he designed and carved himself. The camera zooms in on it. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Many believe that the clues to the location of the Philosopher’s Stone is encoded in these arcane symbols, but its meaning has remained a mystery until this... She holds up a photograph of the statue she scanned in Ir SCARLETT (CONT’D) The fabled “Rose Key,” a kind of Rosetta Stone deciphering alchemical symbols into Aramaic. INT. SCARLETT’S OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: We are seeking money to both finance the expedition to find this mythical stone, and for me to shoot a documentary chronicling Scarlett’s journey.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Let us conquer death together.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SCARLETT’S OFFICE - EVENING Note: from this point forward, everything will be shown i “raw footage” style.  12. The camera powers on, settling on Scarlett at the compute This lacks all the polish displayed in the promo video. T is the beginning of the documentary footage. Scarlett sits at her computer.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Hit refresh. She does. The camera turns to reveal: of $30,000 they’re trying to raise to make their documentary, they are $29,9 of the way there.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Almost there!

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Hit it again.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Give it a moment. She can’t wait. She hits it.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Some moment. $29,990.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: So close.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Hit it again. Hit it again.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You. He hits it. “FUNDED!” Scarlett pops a bottle of champagne, pours them each a gl SCARLETT (CONT’D) Get on camera! He does. They clink glasses.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Like it’s time to get to work. She motions to her statue of the Rose Key.  13.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now all we need is someone who can read Aramaic. (She smiles wryly) Good thing I know a guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett sees a small crowd gathered on a street watching GEORGE, late 20s, handsomely enthusiastic in a bookish wa One look and you know he’s the kind of warm-hearted guy y could always depend on in a pinch.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: This is what I love about Paris. You can literally step up to any corner and there are layers and layers of history going back thousands of years. Someone, name an era. A couple hands go up. George points at one.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: French Revolution.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh, there’s a good one for that. Look at this street right here. In 1795 royalist sympathizers stormed the streets threatening the deputies of the National Convention. Benji walks the camera closer as George talks.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Napoleon Bonaparte, recently made Commander of the Army of the Interior, was asked to stop them. So what does he do? He fires cannons into the crowd! Cannons loaded with pellets so they would literally decimate hundreds of people. So what do you think the government did when they found out? You think they reprimanded him? Put him in jail? Anything? No! They promoted him! You do not want to piss off the French. He looks around at the crowd.  14.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, who wants to pick another era?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: The era of Nicolas Flamel? George knows that voice. He looks like he’s just been hit a 2x4 as he spots Scarlett there listening to him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to the class) Give me a moment, please. George walks to Scarlett.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, I want no part of it.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You haven’t even heard...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I'll save you the time. No. George looks to the camera guy.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who's this guy? (looks to Benji) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: He’s making a film about my search for...

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I’m Benji.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to Benji) Word to the wise... walk, don’t run from this one!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You mean run don’t walk?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Shut up. (to Benji) Did she tell you last time I saw her, I literally wound up in a Turkish prison?!  15.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: It was more like a jail than a prison. George looks at the camera guy and points at her. You get a load of this?!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It was jail. In Turkey. Think she was there waiting for me when I got out?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: (sheepish) I couldn’t let the lead go dead.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: God forbid. Well go on, chase your lead. See how far that gets you. I have a class to teach. He turns to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I found the Rose Key. This stops him in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It was in Iran wasn’t it. (catches himself) Forget I asked, I don’t care. (stops) It was though, wasn’t it.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I knew it! Ha! I knew it!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I need your help translating the Aramaic.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Wait. Did you go to Iran?!  16.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter who went.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You did, didn’t you. By yourself?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter who...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You are such a lunatic. (to the camera) She is a total lunatic. Be careful. (to Scarlett) I‘1ll help translate. But that’s it!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Okay. He smiles, excited despite himself.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (before going) I knew it would be in Iran. INT. GEORGE’S ARCHAEOLOGICAL WORKSHOP - EVENING George and Scarlett look over a small model replica of th statue she found in Iran and a large photo printing of Flamel’s tombstone. Scarlett waits anxiously as George analyzes the symbols writes as he goes. The room is full of artifacts, mud, microscopes. All bone and clay and dirt. All function, no form. Completely lack a woman’s touch.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Almost done?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Shh. She paces. She’s been waiting for this moment all her lif George puts his pen down.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: What does it say?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("oh my God!) It says the Philosopher’s Stone is in the Champs Elysee’s Starbucks bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Okay, let me read. I think it’s in couplets, so let me try to get the rhythm right.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Just tell me what...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Let me do this right... (reads ) “Winged vulture leads your way, with brightest light, in darkest day. Scarlett sits, not sure what this means.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Underneath the heaven's reign, what is lost shall be regained, when halfway twixt the darkest gate and this tablet laid atop this pair'ed fate.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Parrot?!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Pair’ed.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Pair’ed? You mean paired?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yes. But paired doesn’t rhyme.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: And it has to rhyme?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It rhymed in Aramaic. I’m trying to do justice to the translation. 17.  18.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: This tablet? You’re sure it said this tablet?!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Of course I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: This tablet. The headstone is a marker.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Where it was, in a cemetery that no longer exists.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Yeah. “Underneath the heaven's reign, what is lost shall be regained...”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: “What is lost shall be regained.”

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: That’s got to be the Philosopher's Stone.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: “Underneath heaven’s reign...” could be under the night sky...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Or under this tombstone! It’s got a night sky right on it.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: “darkest gate...”

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Hell. “Darkest gate.” The gates of hell.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Okay. But that gives us nothing. Halfway between his grave and the gates of hell?  19.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait! Scarlett rushes to a SMALL NOTEBOOK FULL OF ALCHEMICAL SYMBOLS AND TEXT. It looks like something written by a madman.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: My dad’s notebook. He left it to me. There was something... She rifles through it, finds a page. She slams the book d on the table. George looks at it as the camera looks on. It’s a replica an arcane drawing of the heavenly bodies above the earth, ground, and hell within. But the thing that makes this interesting... the distances are noted.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It has the distances they believed between heaven and earth and hell!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: According to the alchemists, the number of the Devil was 741. Makes sense they would believe hell to be 741 feet beneath the surface of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So halfway twixt this tablet and...

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: 370.5 feet directly beneath his tombstone is where we’ll find the Philosopher’s Stone.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Feet were a bit shorter back then. More like 10.8 inches per foot. Won’t be hard to...

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: How are we going to get 370 feet into the earth?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Scarlett, you're in Paris! She gets his meaning.  20.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: The catacombs!

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: What are “the catacombs?”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It’s a network of tunnels under the streets of Paris, that spans over 200 miles...? No, nothing? He sees Benji really doesn’t know anything about it, so h goes on.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the 1700s, the Cemetaire des Innocents...

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Where the Flamel and his wife were supposedly buried.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Was so full of hundreds of years of dead bodies, that the entire city stank, and people were getting sick. It was disgusting. So... they took all the lime quarries under the city and used them to house the remains of some 6 million bodies. He lets that sink in.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Six million?!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It’s by far the world’s largest crypt.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: So we might be able to just walk right on down there?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: And get your Philosopher's Stone. Which, for the record, I don’t really actually believe in.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You will.  21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett, George and Benji stand on a street corner near where the Flamels were allegedly buried. Scarlett refers her father’s notebook.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: According to Sir Isaac Newton, who was a legendary alchemist, Flamel’s grave was twenty seven paces due north from the fountain.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Let’s walk it out. She paces her steps, counting as she goes. She waves to traffic as she walks right through the busy Paris intersection. George shakes his head, looks to Benji. She stops. Calls back to them.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Right...

dialogues.speaker: HOOONNNKK
dialogues.text: The camera spins as A CAR SCREECHES TO A STOP RIGHT BESID SCARLETT AND THE CAMERA, scaring the shit out of them bot They get out of the street. Scarlett takes a breath, tryi to play off the adrenalin surging through her veins.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 370.5 feet below that point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett marks a large map of Paris with a red x.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: This is where Flamel’s grave was. George lifts a map of the catacombs printed on transparen and pins it over the map of Paris. FLAMEL’S GRAVE FALLS IN AN AREA WITHOUT TUNNELS UNDER IT.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Shit.  22.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: The catacombs don’t go under Flamel’s grave. Scarlett takes a step back. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: We? There’s no we here. I’m helping with translation. That’s it. Scarlett chooses to ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Maybe we could burrow in through this tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Burrow in? You know how thick these walls are? They’re made of solid granite, and they’ve all been reinforced since.... Something occurs to George.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «+. parts of the city collapsed into it! George looks like he’s just been struck by lightning. He feverishly grabs a small handful of pins, races to the map.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In 1774, about 100 feet of Avenue Denfert-Rochereau... He places a pin in the map.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Was literally swallowed up into the ground, falling 100 feet into the earth. He places another pin.  23.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Another collapse happened a few years later at Barriére d'Enfer. Followed by a collapse here at... Avenue des Fontaines! He places a pin right next to the “x” marking Flamel’s gr Scarlett gets where he’s going with this.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Why would the street collapse if it’s nothing but solid ground underneath it?!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Exactly!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: There must be a hidden chamber!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It would appear so.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: We have to get down there.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Again, there’s no “we” here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Scarlett approach the entrance to the official tourist area of the catacombs where other tourists wait i line. Scarlett buys tickets.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Three tickets please.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh, no, I’m not going in. Just two tickets. Scarlett shoots George a strange look.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Three. Scarlett buys three tickets despite George’s reservations  24.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I’m serious. I’m not going in there.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me you’re scared of a little cave?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I... have a thing.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: What kind of thing?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I don’t go underground.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You're an archaeologist!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I know. But I never go underground.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: That's kind of sad. It’s like being a deaf composer or something.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Regardless, you’re not getting me down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benji films Scarlett following the official tour of THE CATACOMBS. Bones and plaques neatly arranged in a morbid antiseptic display. A French tour guide tours the group of Americans and Brit

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: By the 1700s, residents from all over Paris were complaining about the horrible smell of the bodies in the overcrowded cemetery. Something had to be done. Louis the 15th, officially ordered the cemeteries within city limits closed... Another shot:  25. TOUR GUIDE (CONT’D) +. and the remains be brought down here in the old quarries that had been used to build the city.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: This place is creeping me out. I don’t like being in a tomb. Scarlett sees a plaque. “Cemetaire des Innocents.” She turns and talks to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: These remains are from the same cemetery as the Flamels’ graves. Scarlett references her map.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, we're looking to go about half a mile right through this wall. As the tour guide continues, Scarlett cases the structure like an inmate looking for weak links in a prison. Scarlett finds a small gap between the walls. She looks around. The tour is making a little distance.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can squeeze through this. Wait for me. She climbs through the gap in the walls and disappears in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Jesus. You kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Shine the light in here. Benji shines a light into the crevasse. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Scarlett? He turns the camera back to the tour, still barely out of sight, but coming back.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Scarlett?!  26. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: shit. He leans the camera in closer to get a better look, completely getting unnerved by this whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI JUMPS BACK AWAY FROM THE HOLE, DROPPING THE CAMERA.
dialogues.text: Scarlett finds herself pretty funny.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: You're going to make me break the damned camera!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: You are not allowed back there! Please get back into the group! INT. CATACOMBS TOUR ENTRANCE AREA — DAY On the way out, the TICKET TAKER looks punk rock cool. He smiles to Scarlett. She approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: (quietly) Do you know any way to get into the private areas of the catacombs? The Ticket Taker looks around sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET TAKER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Thanks anyway. She notes his Die Antwoord t-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I saw them in Berlin last April. One of the best nights of my life.  27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George waits outside.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You missed a nice tour.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I didn’t see anything that could have... The Ticket Taker hustles to Scarlett. He hands her a club flyer for Club Silencio.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET TAKER
dialogues.text: Ask for Papillon.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Thanks. She nods to him. He nods back and leaves. She holds it up for George to see.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go find Papillon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett, George and Benji get out of a cab.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You sure this is the place?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: That's what it says. Nothing from the street would indicate this was a club. J an average-sized MAN sipping a vodka in front of a nondescript door. Scarlett leads George to the door. The Man stops them. Po to a list.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’re not on the list. He shrugs his shoulders. Not happening.  28. SCARLETT (CONT’D) We're looking for Papillon.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Ah, Papillon?! Why didn't you say so? He opens the door and shows them inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett, George and Benji enter a bizarre Parisian night that resembles a beautifully designed bunker. The Man points to the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Papillon la.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Merci. She leads George and Benji through dancers and lounge-liz to some tables in the back. She finds PAPILLON, sipping a red drink, talking excitedl with friends. Had he been born half a century ago, Papillon surely woul have been a leader of the French Resistance, but in these times must amuse himself with less constructive forms of rebellion. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Papillon?

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Qui étes-vous?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I need to get into the catacombs. I’m told you could take me. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Do I look like a tour guide to you?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Do I look like a tourist? He smiles. Takes a sip of his drink.  29.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Why would I want to bring you down there? She takes a map of the catacombs out of her pocket and sl it onto the table in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Because we've found a secret passage that nobody knows about. Papillon looks at the markings. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: We would have found it if it was there.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: No you wouldn’t have. It was designed to not be seen.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Why would that be?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Because, I believe, it’s full of treasure. Papillon laughs. Looks to George.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Is she serious? George nods. PAPILLON (CONT’D) Me and my friends can take half this treasure?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You can have it all. That’s not what we're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Half is probably fine.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: You are a strange girl, aren’t you.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You don’t know the half of it.  30. INT. PAPILLON’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Papillon throws a couple pairs of rubber waders and helme to George and Scarlett.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Try these.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m not going in. I’m just here for support.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: He’s coming. George, I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: This guy seems to know what he’s doing.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: But who knows what we’1ll come across down there. I can’t decipher it all without you. Come on, we were a good team, remember?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Text it to me and I'll...

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: No cell phones down there. Ground is too dense.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So there’s no way to call for help if something goes wrong?

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Then I’m definitely not going. A knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: (shouts ) Entrez! (to Scarlett) My team. In walks ZED, a quiet, squirrely Frenchman of 25, with la calves and strong hands. A perfectly designed climbing machine.  31. He’s trailed by SOUXIE, a motherly Goth girl. She’s the d mother of the cataphiles. PAPILLON (CONT’D) This is Zed, the last letter in climbing. And Souxie. The banshee. She sees all the waders and helmets and everything all ov the place.

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: Ah, what a mess Papillon!

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: She also manages our supplies. Souxie sorts through the supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group stands around a map of the catacombs.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: We'll enter through the park. That will make it easier to find La Taupe.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: La Taupe?

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: “The Mole.”

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: He lives down there.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: He lives down there?!

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: Oui.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Weird. Papillon points to a spot on the map.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: He is usually around...

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: But that’s the wrong direction.  32.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Sometimes going the wrong direction is the quickest way.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Do we really need this guy? We have Maps and...

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Oui. We need this guy. INT. PAPILLON’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Souxie counts out all the flashlights, clothes, etc. She tests each flashlight herself. She notices the camera and talks.

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: It is dangerous underground. If you run out of batteries, and no flashlight, you will die. If you run out of water... If you get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: There are also dangers of cave ins, police, rats, bats, claustrophobia, drowning, bugs.

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: Many things can go wrong down there. We need to plan for them all. There is no room for mistakes. Papillon checks food and water.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: And we always bring enough food and water for a week.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: A week?! Papillon shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett and George follow Souxie, Papillon, and Zed into dark wooded area in a park in Paris.  33. Papillon stops them about 50 feet shy of a dirt mound wit hole in it, surrounded by concrete and graffiti. The hole looks more like something a raccoon would live in. He and Zed scan the area for police.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: The police hate me here. All clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach the hole. A tight fit dropping into darknes Not something you’d ever want to climb into.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You're going in that?! Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Let’s turn on the cameras. Benji comes around beside Scarlett. He turns on the GoPro attached to her headlamp. He makes a dipshit face into th camera.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: B camera, good check. He approaches Zed, who also has one on his headlamp. Benj flips it on. Makes a dipshit face into camera.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C camera good check. Benji nods to Papillon. Ready. Scarlett hands George a ruck sack.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Here. He looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Your bag.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You have some serious listening skill issues.  34.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Zed... Allez! Zed drops through the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed climbs swiftly through a jagged shaft of rock to the floor of the catacombs.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Scarlett continue their discussion.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I need you on this.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Scarlett, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Souxie... Allez! Souxie disappears through the hole. PAPILLON (CONT’D) (to George) I don’t care what you do, but make up your mind now.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I’m not coming.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: He’s coming.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA FROM AN OPEN FIELD TACKLE BY A PARISIAN POLICEMAN.
dialogues.text: A whistle blows. The camera spins to find a second police running toward them.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Allez! Allez! Allez!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Sorry George.  35. She jumps through the hole and disappears. George stands there, looking at his bag. At the hole. At oncoming policeman.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Shit. Shit. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Allez! Allez! Benji jumps through the hole with the camera, followed closely by George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benji makes his way down though the jagged rocks as Zed points out the safe places to steps. George appears, with ruck sack.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You fuckers. Shit! Scarlett looks around the catacombs. This is much rougher than the official tourist area, but in its way, much more beautiful. Paintings and graffiti on the walls give it an urban, cool vibe.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: This is beautiful. George looks a bit shell shocked to be down here. Scarlet greets him.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I knew you’d come with us.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks. Papillon appears above, dropping like a bat into hell. He hits every wall on the way down.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Allez! Allez! Allez! Papillon digs furiously in his pockets as they race throu the tunnels, fleeing from the police.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Arret! Arret!  36. Papillon lights up a smoke bomb, drops it. The effect of gathering smoke is eerie, unsettling.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Careful! Papillon leaps over a two foot hole in the floor. Followe Scarlett, and the rest. He motions into an alcove where they wait for the smoke t clear.

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: The catacombs make the police nervous. They don’t like to go very deep in here.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I don’t blame them. As the smoke clears, they see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are in a kind of artists’ gallery. The walls are all painted, beautiful. The police are nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Ha ha. Police will never catch Papillon! An ARTIST creeps out of the shadows and curses Papillon o for bringing the authorities there. He hates the smoke bo and despises the tourists that Papillon brought with him.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIST
dialogues.text: Cessez de réduire la police ici!

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Détendez. Je les ai évités avant que nous soyons arrivés ici.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIST
dialogues.text: Et cette fumée ruine ma peinture.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Bonne chose que votre peinture est terrible. Scarlett approaches the Artist’s work. It really is beautiful.  37.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: C'est trés beau. The Artist appreciates this very much.

dialogues.speaker: ARTIST
dialogues.text: Merci.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Avez-vous vu la Taupe?

dialogues.speaker: ARTIST
dialogues.text: Non. Il n'a pas 6té par ici.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: La Taupe has not been here. We must look for him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: There are over 200 miles of tunnels. You suggesting we wander them aimlessly until we find this weirdo?

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Je ne sais pas. Papillon leads them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papillon leads them through a corridor as Scarlett looks her map.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: (calling out) La Taupe? C’est moi, Papillon.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Wait! We’re going in the wrong direction. We need to be going that way.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: We haven’t found La Taupe.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Is it possible that he’s not down here?

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: The artist said he just saw La Taupe a couple hours ago.  38.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: No he didn’t. I speak French. That’s not what he said.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: La Taupe knows every cave. Scarlett holds up her map.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: So do I.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: You think because you see something in a book you know it?! Papillon smacks the map as he talks. Going the PAPILLON (CONT’D) This is not the catacombs! This will not tell you anything! Which ones are filled with water? Which ones are too full of bones to pass? Which ones have collapsed?! If you want to follow this map go ahead. I’m going to find La Taupe because these caves are dangerous and you need to know where you're going!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I’m going. Who’s with me.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Scarlett. He’s right.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Why are we wasting our time with...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You know I don’t want to spend an extra minute down here than I have to. But if this guy says he needs La Taupe, I’m inclined to trust him.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: He doesn’t even know that the guy is down here. Or where he is. slow way is very much against Scarlett’s nature.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: If the stone is down here, it’s been here for six hundred years. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’ll keep for a couple extra hours. She reluctantly relents.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Okay. George turns to Papillon.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Now, don’t make me look like an asshole. As they cross through another room, strange electronic mu plays.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papillon leads them through a slightly larger space. On o side, half a dozen cataphiles sit in what look like stone bleachers cut into the wall. On the other side, a movie -- the old silent version of “Phantom of the Opera” with Lon Chaney. The image has bee “remixed” to Aphex Twin, creating an interesting blend of and new. The movie shows the Phantom descending under the Parisian Opera house into the catacombs.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Our cinema. George looks at the relaxed Parisians watching a movie do here.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You guys are freaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they cross through a corridor, Papillon points out a s replica of the Bocca della Verita in Rome. (A giant disk carved face with an open mouth.) He nudges George, points at it.  40.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: According to legend, this statue will bite off your hand if you tell a lie. George is loosening up a bit.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Let's give it a shot. He reaches his hand toward it, thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You might not believe this, but my nipples are perfectly shaped like little Elvis heads. Early Elvis. George slides his hand into the carved mouth.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aaah! Shit! I hate this place. Papillon has a good laugh at George.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks guy. As they cross to the far end of the corridor, they hear something -- A kind of industrial dance music. The beats build as they closer. Papillon looks to the others, does a little rave-y dance, smiles, and runs toward the music. George and Scarlett look to each other. This fucking guy. The music gets louder as they get closer. As they turn a bend, they see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN underground rave, lit in flashing reds and pulsing tec music. People shuffle and dance like the possessed. At a glance, it looks like people might be having sex in dark corners. Others are scantily clad, in underwear or l People wearing masks and horns and animal headdresses. Th kind of underground party we all know probably happens somewhere, but would never get invited to ourselves.  41. Papillon pushes his way through the crowd, trying to ask people - through the noise - if they’ve seen La Taupe. A SKINHEAD grabs Scarlett, pulls her into the crowd, star grinding on her. He’s wearing nothing but combat boots an his underwear, revealing a swastika on his chest. Scarlett pushes away, but he’s aggressive. George jumps forward, hitting the Skinhead across the fac slamming him back through the crowd and onto his back. Other Ravers jump to the Skinhead’s aid, striking George the mouth. Scarlett tries to intervene on George’s behalf but no words can be heard over the pulsing music. People, very tough, very scary people corner George. One takes a swing, but George blocks it. George gets ready fo real fight. He’s amped up. Scarlett inserts herself between George and the crowd. Papillon pushes his way through, and holds the ravers off George. Scarlett and George push their way through the crowd and out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they clear the room, the flashlights overpower the strobes. They can hear again. George touches the back of his hand to his mouth and sees blood.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to Scarlett) You’re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I didn’t thank you.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: That guy was all over you.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I could've handled it myself.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, really?  42.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Those people are crazy people. Dangerous people. Papillon makes a crazy sign with his hands. PAPILLON (CONT’D) You overreact.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I literally punched a Nazi. How am I suddenly the asshole?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I’m not some damsel in distress. I don’t need your help. George looks around. At himself. In the catacombs.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah? Since when?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: (playful) Don’t kid yourself. You wouldn’t want to go toe-to-toe with me. I’m pretty tough.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You?! That’s ridiculous. She draws a line in the sand on the floor. Stands on Geor side of it.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Try to move me across this line. I’1l show you. Papillon laughs and claps.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I’m not going to push a girl.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Because you’re scared of her?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I’m not... this is so stupid. What, you have some self-defense-class-— karate-move you learned in case somebody tries to grab you? That’s all well and good unless somebody pushes you...  43. He rushes at her.

dialogues.speaker: ...LIKE THIS
dialogues.text: Scarlett steps toward him, nails him in the solar plexus, knocking the wind out of George.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: oh!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I might know a little more than a self-defense-class-karate-move. Papillon laughs, raises her hand up in victory.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: The champion!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I think he just called you a mushroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter an alcove with bright fluorescent paint on the walls, a lot of it of mushrooms or other hallucinogenic-— inspired motifs. Papillon calls down a tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: La Taupe? They are all looking a bit tired. They’ve covered a lot o ground already. A voice calls out from the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Chantez-le? Papillon stops, does a weird little jig.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: (sings) La Taupe, La Taupe, La Taupe. C’est moi, c’est moi, c’est moi. Papi, Papi, Papi, ion, ion ion. From the darkness, a voice sings.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Papi, papi, papi, ion, ion, ion. C'est moi, c’est moi aussi, La Taupe est le garcon! La Taupe rushes out of the shadows and gives Papillon a b hug, his face obscured in shadows under his hooded sweatshirt.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Mon ami étrange!

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Mon ami puant! La Taupe looks at Scarlett and George suspiciously. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) Qui sont-elles ?

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Ils sont ok. Vous ne vous inquiétez pas.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Pourquoi ont-ils des appareils- photo?

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Ils font un documentaire environ...

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Non! La Taupe covers his face with his hand. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) (to the camera) You cannot film me! I do not permit to you filming me. Benji drops the camera low. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) Go. Get out of these place! He takes a beer bottle and throws it at them, almost hitt George.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Whoa! Papillon holds up a hand. Give me a sec. He walks off wit Taupe.  45.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This doesn’t bode well. George and the gang watch Papillon and La Taupe exchange terse words. After a discussion, Papillon returns.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: He will join us.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: If we still want him. Guy threw a bottle at my head.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: He just threw it. It wasn’t at your head.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It skimmed my head. I felt it on my hair.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: But first he sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Sleeps?! Did you say, “first he sleeps?!"

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: He has eaten the... how you say... Papillon looks around, points to a graffiti image of a mushroom. PAPILLON (CONT’D) These.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Mushrooms?

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Oui. Mushrooms.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: He’s on mushrooms?!

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: How long ago did he eat them?  46.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Two hours.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So he’s going to be high for like another six?! Scarlett looks at him. George shrugs his shoulders. I kno what's up.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: We stay here for the night.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: For the night?!

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Yes. We sleep.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No. Fuck this. I’m out. I gotta get out of this place. I’m packing my shit up and leaving.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: How will you find your way back out?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It’s that way. The camera pans off to show the long, dark corridor, Geor points at.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Try. We’ll send a search party for you in a couple days.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You know, I’m getting real sick of your tone.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: I’m sure the skinhead party would love to see you again without me to save you.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You didn’t save me.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just try to relax.  47.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Because I’m trapped under the ground! In a rat filled tunnel that was dug in the 1500s. Our tour guide is high as a kite and so far we've been walking in the wrong direction. What could possibly stop me from relaxing?! Papillon lights up a joint. Offers some to George.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Perfect solution. Let’s everyone get high. I’m sure nothing bad could happen then. Papillon turns to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait. Give me that. George has a hit off the joint.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: It’s good, yes?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: We have better in America. Papillon smiles. George does too. Maybe this won’t be so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glow sticks light the space to save flashlights. La Taupe, now wearing a kind of industrial mole mask that he’1l continue to wear, spins little flaming balls on str to music. It’s kind of beautiful. Souxie takes something out of a small kit. She crosses ou the room into the darkness of a tunnel by herself. Papillon drinks beer and talks with Scarlett and La Taupe Zed practices throwing rocks into a bucket.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: You don’t seem like a treasure hunter.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I’m not really.  48.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Then why search for this stone?

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: It doesn’t make any sense! A rock that can turn other rocks to gold and - AND - can also make you live forever. Doesn’t make sense.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Science was different back then. Alchemists were looking for a connection between what was inside them and what they were observing in the outside world. They were trying to perfect themselves, make themselves pure as gold while working in metals. They respected inner truth more than outside facts. She turns back to Papillon. SCARLETT (CONT’D) I guess I’m not searching for treasure so much as I’m searching for proof of the miraculous. Because if even one alchemist succeeded, if one perfected himself and his own mind and talents and knowledge to the point that he could bend the laws of physics... then we all could. Every one of us. Papillon shrugs. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Gold is good too. Scarlett grabs a couple beers and crosses the room toward George. The camera turns to George, anxiously sitting alone. Scarlett approaches George with a beer.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You okay? George shrugs a bit.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Not my favorite place.  49.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: So I gathered. She offers George a beer. He takes it. SCARLETT (CONT’D) When’s the last time we had a beer together?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It’s been awhile, hasn’t it.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You never returned my calls. After Turkey.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I left you there.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I’m glad you're here.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (reluctant) Yeah. Me too. If you’re right, this could be the greatest archaeological find... ever. As big as finding the Holy Grail.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I know. George looks around the space.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I used to love exploring caves with my brother as a kid. He was so daring and cool and older. He remembers it all so vividly.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A rock I was standing on dislodged and rolled onto his leg, pinning him. We tried and tried but couldn’t get him out. I went to get help, but I got lost trying to find my way back.  50. This pains George terribly.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By the time we found him, the tide had come in, and he was gone.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: That’s awful. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It wasn’t because you left me there.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Why I didn’t call you back. It wasn’t because you left me.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: It wasn’t? He looks at her seriously.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I was afraid I was falling in love with someone so obsessed with the dead, there’s no room left over to love the living. She takes this in for a moment. Not one to take criticism easily.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: And I never thought I’d fall for the kind of guy who runs the second things get complicated. She turns and goes back to the fire with the others.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Shit. Camera powers off.  51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. Snores. Sleeping people rustling around. Someon moves in the space.

dialogues.speaker: BA-BA-BA-BA-BA-BA-BA
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the opening chords of the White Stripes, “I Thi Smell a Rat” rip through the darkness. Everyone frantically searches for a light. George is first to get his hands on a flashlight which he flips on and looks for the source of the music. It’s La Taupe in his industrial mole mask, blaring a ster at them, “Say Anything” style. He dances to the music and laughs at their startled reactions. He turns off the music.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: We go. La Taupe turns and leaves down a corridor, expecting them catch up.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Asshole. The bleary-eyed explorers hustle to pack up and follow.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: (to Papillon) This “Mole” guy always so annoying? Papillon shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: He gets worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La Taupe winds them through corridor after corridor. He k his way around here like his own neighborhood. George tries to talk with him.  52.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Papillon told me you pretty much live down here?

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Down here there is no rules. No law. Here I do whatever I want when I want it.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You do a lot of drugs, don’t you.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Yes. George looks around.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I can’t imagine a place I'd less want to eat mushrooms. (thinks) Maybe jail. It’s a toss up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La Taupe stops in front of a corridor filled with human bones.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Stay on top. Parce que rats.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Careful there are...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, we get it. La Taupe scrambles over the bones effortlessly. George goes next, followed by Scarlett, each crawling beh the next.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: (to George) Come closer. Get close. George crawls over the bones, getting closer behind La Ta not sure why Taupe is asking him to do so. La Taupe rips a fart right into George’s face, and laughs George looks back to Scarlett.  53.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Not sure why the French have such a reputation for being rude. I've always found them so pleasant. The camera moves with Scarlett as she climbs across the bones. She is anxious as the bones creak underneath her. swarm of rats make noise underneath. The tunnel gets tighter and tighter as they go, to the po that Scarlett is barely thin enough to fit through. Benji gets caught.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: I’m stuck.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Fat tourist!

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: (to La Taupe) Arret!

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: I can’t move. Scarlett struggles to turn back to Benji.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Can you take off your pack?

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: I already did. Benji struggles more and more against the space.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You're making it worse! Stop struggling. Take a breathe.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Ah! The rats are nipping at me. Go! Just go! I need to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Benji stop! Stop! You need to back up a bit. You’re lodged and...

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Fuck! I hate this.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Move back. Just inch back.  54.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: No! No! Just...

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Benji! The only way forward is backward! INCH BACK! INCH BACK!

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. He inches back.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are people behind me too! I just need to get out of here! I don’t like this.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Move your right shoulder down and inch back. Benji moves. SCARLETT (CONT’D) No, no, no, I’m sorry. Your left shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: I'm freaking out. I need to get out.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Keep breathing. Just take a deep breath with me.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: No, I need...

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Take a deep breath! Scarlett takes a deep breath and exhales. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Your body expands when your blood pressure rises. You need to calm yourself. Come on. She does it again. He joins her this time.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: It’s not helping.  55.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You're going to be okay. Move your right shoulder down an inch.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Like this?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: That's right. Now see if you can adjust the bones underneath you. Flatten them out, line them up.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Okay. His shaking hands arrange the bones.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ow! A rat just bit me! Ah! Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: It’s okay. It’s okay, Benji. You’re going to be fine. Just follow me. Benji pulls against the cave. It rumbles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: It’s gonna collapse.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Just push! Push through it! He does. And finally breaks free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all file out of the bone tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: This is why we don’t bring fat Irish tourist to the catacombs. La Taupe jabs his finger into Benji’s gut.  56. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) This guy, this fat guy he do not belong here. Fat guy, you should have taken fat man hall. La Taupe points to another hallway that leads to this sam end point. They didn’t have to do this to Benji.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: We didn’t even have to go through there?! Why are you making this harder than it has to be?!

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: It’s more interesting this way. Scarlett snaps. She pushes him up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I don’t care who you think you are, but the next time you take a chance with my people, I’1l hurt you. Seriously. La Taupe’s mouth, showing under his mole mask, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: English girl has fire. He nods that he understands, amused by Scarlett’s spunk. The ceiling dusts them all a bit.

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: We shouldn’t stay very long.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Was that bad? They look to see a stone pillar that should be holding up ceiling has fallen.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: That is bad.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: We're still not deep enough. We’re only two hundred feet below ground. We need to go down another hundred. The ceiling dusts them again.  57.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I think we should move out of this area. It seems suspect to me.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: (to La Taupe) We need to go deeper. He reluctantly nods.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La Taupe leads them into the next corridor. He shines his light around until he finds some planks of wood on the ground. He pries them up, revealing a hole in the floor t goes very deep. George looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: This is a bad idea, Scarlett.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Papillon, could you take George and anyone else back who wants to go? I’m going deeper.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: And let you keep all the treasure? No, I’m going with you.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to Scarlett) At what point will you stop?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: When I find it.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: And if there is no stone?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: There is. And it’s down there. She nods to La Taupe.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Allez.  58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One after another, they descend deeper and deeper into th catacombs. They’re all feeling the tension of going this underground. George looks up to the vast distance above him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to La Taupe) How do you know we’ll all be able to get back up there?

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: If we can’t, we die. So we will.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Not really the answer I was hoping for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all wade through the muck 300 feet underground. Spir are sagging.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: How long have we been walking? George looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: About 6 hours.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Can we stop to eat soon?

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Hungry fat Irish.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Jesus, give it a rest! At least I live in the real world! This kind of animosity is settling over all of them.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (sings) Just sit right back and you'll hear a tale, A tale of a fateful trip, That started from this tropic port Aboard this tiny ship. Scarlett smiles. Joins in.  59.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE AND SCARLETT
dialogues.text: The mate was a mighty sailing man, The skipper brave and sure. Five passengers set sail that day For a three hour tour... Benji jumps in too.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, SCARLETT AND BENJI
dialogues.text: a three hour tour. Papillon won’t be outdone. He jumps in on the next stanza French, trying to out-sing them with the French version o the song.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, SOPHIE AND BEN PAPILLON
dialogues.text: The weather started getting Devenir commencée par temps rough, rugueuse, Le bateau minuscule The tiny ship was tossed, a été jeté en l'air, Sinon If not for the courage of the pour le courage de 1'équipa fearless crew courageux que le Vairon The Minnow would be lost, the serait détruit, le Vairon Minnow would be lost. soyez détruit. The other French speakers jump in too, everyone now singi at the top of their lungs for language domination.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, SOPHIE AND BEN PAPILLON, TAUPE, SOUXIE, ZED
dialogues.text: (CONT'D) La terre réglée de bateau sur The ship set ground on the le rivage de cette ile shore of this uncharted inexplorée de désert avec desert isle Gilligan With Gilligan Le capitaine aussi, The Skipper too, Le millionnaire et son The millionaire and his wife, épouse, The movie star La star de cinéma, le The professor and Mary Ann, professeur et Mary Ann, ici Here on Gilligans Isle. sur l'ile de Gilligans. They all get so loud, they miss La Taupe shouting to them

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Arret! Arret! They all stop. They have reached the end of the tunnel. Nothing but a wall in front of them. Scarlett references her map.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Should be another ten feet that way.  60.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: There is no more. Scarlett picks up a stone and taps on the wall. Solid. She looks around, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: There must be another way to get there. La Taupe consults his own personal map of the system of caves. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: There is no more. C’est fini. They all look for any sign of anything. But there is noth there.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Does this mean, no treasure?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: (bummed ) Dommage. I was excited to be rich. Scarlett scans the surface for a sign, an inscription, anything. She thinks and thinks. She looks at her map. Mutters to herself, thinking through everything that’s led them here getting more and more frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: There’s nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Sorry Scarlett.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I really thought we had it right.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I know. He sees how sad she is.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For what it’s worth, I thought we had it right too.  61.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Are we ready to go the other direction?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Scarlett.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Yeah... Scarlett looks down at the compass on her wrist. A flash insight! SCARLETT (CONT’D) Wait! Wait! Direction! Magnetic north!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Magnetic north! True north remains fixed, but magnetic north shifts about 2.5 degrees per hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Which by now would have produced Asee

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Variation of about 15 degrees. Not here. There! A second small tunnel leading off the one they’re in. The race into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett throws her pack down and scans the walls with he fingers. She digs into the stone. Sees something.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh my God. There’s something there!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I know! She digs and digs.  62.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Don’t wreck it.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: La Taupe does not like the vultures. La Taupe is right, on the wall is a SMALL INSCRIPTION OF VULTURE.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Winged vulture! She looks to George.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What was it?! “Winged vulture leads your way.”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: “,..with brightest light, in darkest day.” She looks at the vulture up close.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: “Winged vulture leads your way...” She follows the angle of the vulture’s beak across the wa until it hits a second wall. She digs around at the joint of the two walls. Sure enoug there’s a crease! SCARLETT (CONT’D) There’s something here! George is there in a flash. SCARLETT (CONT’D) I think it’s a Ptolemaic hinge! It looks like a scarab embedded in the stone. She kneels and finds another one.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Really?! I’ve never seen one before.  63.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: What’s a Ptolemaic hinge?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: It’s how they sealed pharaohs' tombs in ancient Egypt. The hinges formed a kind of riddle almost like an ancient padlock. There are a series of moves you must get precisely correct.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Or what?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Or it’1ll fall on you and crush you. Or the ceiling would collapse, or something else awful that would probably kill you.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Jesus. She gets ready to give it a shot. The cataphiles cautious back away, just in case.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! What are you doing?! Giving it the old college try?!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You have a better idea?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Go home. Not get crushed and die. She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Okay, you do that, but I’m going to take a shot. He hesitates for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
