dialogues.text: Against my better judgement, may I ask what your plan is? She opens her notebook...

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: What was the... on the tomb...  64.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: “Underneath heaven’s reign...”

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Heaven's reign. The celestial spheres! 8 planets. Except Uranus wasn’t discovered yet. 7 planets. She gets ready to pull the door.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Wait! Was this built before or after Copernicus?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Good point. Before.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So they still believed everything rotated around the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Which means, the Earth was not counted as a planet.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: But the moon was. As was the sun.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: So eight?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: That’s my count. She slides the stone out to the seventh line. The ceiling rumbles as the weight resettles. They look at it. Seems okay.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s next?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Now we twist.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: How far? Scarlett remembers the inscription out loud.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: .-. “atop this pair'ed fate.”  65.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Pair... twins?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Twins! Of course, Gemini! According to the Egyptian calendar, Gemini would fall at three o’clock on a dial. Ready? George nods nervously. Papillon backs up. She twists the stone and it spirals outward as it moves. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Okay... okay... Gemini. She stops. The ceiling rumbles a bit again. Sand pours fr beside the stone as the rumbling intensifies.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I don’t like this game. The stone slides toward them.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Back up! La Taupe runs for the door.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I don’t know. The stone drops out of place and lands on the floor with thud, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERSON TO SQUEEZE THROUGH. La Taupe quickly crowds in to look. Scarlett shines a light into it, but it doesn’t reveal mu beyond a single rat scurrying out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No way I’m crawling through that.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Ditto.  66.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: This is probably the first time someone has shined a light in that space in over 500 years.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: A new tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: The treasure.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Give me a boost. Papillon places his knee so she can use it to climb throu Scarlett climbs into the hole. She barely squeezes through, but keeps going and going an going. Her breathing gets labored as she pulls her way through. From the door side of the hole, we see her clear the othe end. She turns back to face the others.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: George. You gotta see this. George thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: George. Seriously. Come here. George really doesn’t want to do this.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Shit. He climbs into the hole and struggles through it to join Scarlett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George comes out the other side and rolls out of the hole He stands to find: A tomb, atop which is laid A CORPSE, CLEARLY SEVERAL CENTURIES OLD, PERFECTLY PRESERVED.  67.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: He’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: How is he not rotting?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I don’t know. The headstone is marked “C.R. Of R.C.”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: C.R. Of R.C.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Christian Rosenkreuz of the Rosy Cross.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No! The founder of the Rosecrucians?! Holy shit. (catches his language, apologizes to the corpse) Sorry. (to Scarlett) His tomb was found by Rosicrucians in the 1600s. Along with the secrets of...

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: ..-alchemy which reignited its interest for the next 200 years. George notes another inscription.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: “VITRIOL.” What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: The motto of alchemy. It stands for: “Visita Interiora Terrae Rectificando Invenies Occultum Lapidem.”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (translates) “Visit the Interior Parts of the Earth; by Rectification Thou Shalt Find the Hidden Stone.” The others have been filing in.  68.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yes. For 700 years.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: Creepy. The middle of the chamber is filled with water, making it echo creepily in the space.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: There’s more. “Visit the interior parts of the earth.” He’s saying to go deeper.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: We're kind of interior already, don’t you think?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: What was the... “Winged vulture leads your way. In brightest light in darkest day.” Scarlett sees something in the water. Looks closer. She turns off her flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Turn off your flashlights. Everyone!

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: With a dead body in here? No way.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Just do it. They all do so, Benji having the hardest time submitting darkness. But as Benji clicks off the onboard light, submerging the group in total darkness, we see what Scarlett saw: traces light deep in the water. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Where’s that light coming from if that’s a wall? Papillon flips his flashlight on, pokes at the wall. Scar drops herself down into the water.  69. The camera travels with Scarlett under the water as her h pokes at the stone deep in the water. She rises back up, now soaking wet. SCARLETT (CONT’D) There’s a loose stone. Someone help me. Papillon jumps in with her. The two drop into the water. Again the camera drops in with them as they pull against large stone. They dislodge it and pull it away from the w revealing more light. Scarlett just comes up long enough to take a breath, and her backpack off. She then dives back down into the murky brown water, push herself through the opening and swims into a brighter lig She clears the wall and pulls herself up on the other sid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she rises up, it is obvious that THIS IS THE PLACE THE BEEN SEARCHING FOR.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Ooh! There are lit torches on the walls. Gold all around them. The floors, walls and ceiling are lined in alchemical sym and ancient Egyptian symbology. Eerie and magical at the time. Scarlett laughs, still not believing her eyes. SCARLETT (CONT’D) I found it, Dad. You were right. George comes up out of the water. He sees what she does.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Yeah. She can’t help but get choked up.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It’s real.  70.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: It’s real. George takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I think we’re gonna need a bigger bag. La Taupe rises out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Mon dieu. He takes a gold coin. Shoves it in his pocket. And anothe and another.

dialogues.speaker: PAPILLON
dialogues.text: I’m quitting my job!!! There is a big pile of coins that seem wedged between the floor and ceiling. La Taupe pulls at them, trying to disl them. Souxie and Zed appear, and also pocket coins.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: How are these torches lit?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: The Philosopher’s Stone can fuel a lamp for eternity.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So where is it? The stone.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: “The brightest light in darkest day.”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: The sun. She smiles. She points at an ancient-Egyptian-inspired painting of a god stretched across the floor of the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: In ancient Egypt, the earth god and the sky goddess... She points to the ceiling, where a goddess, lined with st hangs.  71. SCARLETT (CONT’D) «+. were madly in love. But when they had they first child, the sun, he became so jealous of their affections that he pushed them apart from each other, leaving them only able to touch by the palms of their hands and the soles of their feet. She points now to a winged stone painted between the two gods.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every morning the sky gives birth to the sun and every evening she swallows him back up. She takes out a knife and makes her way to the winged sto With all the opulence surrounding them, this one chalky purple stone would hardly be worth noting.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: That’s it? It looks so ordinary. Scarlett smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: What better place to hide the most valuable stone ever known, than beside riches you could never miss. Papillon and La Taupe furiously bag piles of coins and ot treasures. Scarlett uses her knife to edge the stone out of its plac and carefully places it in a cloth satchel she brought specifically for this.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t believe the trouble I went through to find you. She tucks the stone into a waterproof pocket. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Okay, let’s get out of here. They turn around. La Taupe and Papillon pull furiously at mound of coins wedged so tightly between floor and ceilin it takes two of them to pull the coins free.  72. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Wait! Is that... She looks at the ceiling. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Load bearing?!! As the coins break free, THE CEILING CRACKS. Chunks drop around them.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Run! They all struggle get up and run like mad as THE CEILING CRUMBLES OVER THEM.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: A huge echoing crash as THE CEILING DROPS. They race away from it, barely escaping being crushed under its weight. Brown dust completely envelops them, blotting out all the light in the room. Nothing but darkness. It’s suddenly ve quiet, still. Some coughing and struggling. Someone is crying, in pain. Scarlett’s voice is the first to pierce the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Is everyone okay?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think I’m okay.

dialogues.speaker: ZED, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Oui.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I am. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Papillon? Souxie? Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Papillon?! Souxie?! As the dust begins to settle, traces of their head lamps through the darkness.  73. The sounds of whimpering, muffled.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hear someone! The air clears a bit more. A hand sticks out of the rubbl George is on it in a second, pulling stones off and tossi them aside. Souxie breaks through the rubble. Coughing. In pain.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: Papillon! George pulls her out of the rubble. She’s banged up and bruised, has a nasty cut on her arm, but she’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Papillon, if you’re goofing around... Nothing. Scarlett sifts back into the rubble. No sign of Papillon. Zed drops under the water and looks. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Jesus. Papillon?! Nothing. George turns on La Taupe.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You asshole! You could have killed us all! George goes after Taupe, but Scarlett and Zed intervene.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Stop! We shouldn’t disrupt the space any more than we already have.

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: Is Papillon... dead?

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: We're all dead! That was the only way out!  74. He’s right. They are all enclosed in a small room with no exit.

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: Ay! Souxie’s arm is hurting her.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Where’s the first aid kit? We need to clean up that cut. They all look around.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: The packs are buried.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Water? Food? They all look at each other. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Spare batteries? Nope.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Once the headlamps go out...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Let’s start conserving. George turns his off, dropping the light of the space dow considerably. Benji does the same. George pokes around at the rubble, looking for a way out.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe we could dig our way out.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: With what? Your hands?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: He’s right. This chamber was created by master builders. If they wanted to trap the unworthy, we’re trapped.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So what, we just sit here and wait for the air to run out?! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're all just cool hanging out waiting to die?! George looks around the room. They’re all trying to wrap their heads around the situation. Terrified. Scarlett looks closer at the structure around them.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Those lamps are Freemason by design.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Freemasons never built something like this without a back door, just in case it collapsed on them. She keeps inspecting their surroundings. She takes a rock taps on the walls, listening for something that sounds hollow. Nothing. The floor and the ceiling seem to be painted and inscribe the same exact way, almost as if there were a mirror runn the length of the floor. SCARLETT (CONT’D) “As above, so below.” That phrase is the key to all magic. She continues to search for something that doesn’t fit wh continuing her thought.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It means, basically, what is within me is outside of me. What is on earth is in heaven. As I am, so are my cells, so are my atoms. Basically, what I believe the world to be, so it is. She sees something. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Look. She points to a rectangle inscribed on the ceiling that’s covered in alchemical symbols.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porta Alchemica. The door to the mystical.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So it’s a door?! George grabs a rock and gets ready to chisel at it.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: No! Look. That symbol of the door on the ceiling is the only thing not replicated on the floor. 76. Scarlett shines the light from the rectangle on the ceili down to the floor directly beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: “Bs above, so below.”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So if...

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: If they painted a door on the ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Then there would be a door on the floor too.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: There is nothing below us. This is the bottom of the Catacombs. Scarlett takes the rock from George. She kneels down in t water in the gutter at the bottom of the chamber. She hit with the rock. Hits it again. And again. CRACK. She looks around at the others as the water drains of the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to La Taupe) That water must be going somewhere. Scarlett doubles her efforts, hitting the shit out of the rock until.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor of the gutter beneath her gives. She rushes awa from it as the stones beneath her feet give way and disap off into nothingness.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: This isn’t catacombs. Look at the edges. This wasn’t made by man. Who knows where this could lead.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, it’s a possible way out.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh, going deeper. Scarlett picks a rope and lowers herself down into the ch The descent is eerie, dark. They watch as she goes. And goes. And goes. Scarlett stops. She takes a flashlight and shines it arou looking at what’s in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: There’s a passage down here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett places her feet on the ground and looks up to fi A very small opening with a large stone arch over it. It looks ancient. Very, very ancient. The others file in behind her. Something about this space makes them all feel uneasy. Scarlett notes the ancient inscriptions on the arch.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Can you read that? What does it say? George dusts it off to get a better look. Reads it quietl himself, thinking through the meaning.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: “Abandon all hope, ye who enter here.” Scarlett understands.  78.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: According to mythology, that’s the inscription over the gates of hell.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: I’m not going in there.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: (to La Taupe) I thought you didn’t believe in any of this.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: I don’t. La Taupe is deeply unnerved by the idea of crossing this threshold, but there truly is no other choice. The entrance is so small, so low to the ground that they’ have to slide through it one at a time. Scarlett notes it.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: “And they shall be made to crawl on their bellies into the kingdom of darkness.”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. That occurred to me too.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: I don’t like this. They prepare themselves to cross through. Scarlett goes for it. She slides her pack through and fol closely behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett stands up in the next room to find: IT’S EXACTLY THE SAME AS THE ALCHEMIST CHAMBER THAT COLLA ON THEM. Same artwork on the ceiling. Same gold. Same mis Philosopher’s Stone. Though this room is still intact.  79. It sounds a bit different this side of the threshold. Lik faint throbbing drone in the background. George stands up behind Scarlett, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Whoa. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: It’s exactly the same. Scarlett points at one of the painted gods on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Not exactly. They’re facing the other direction. She's right. This room looks like THE MIRROR IMAGE of the earlier Alchemist Chamber that collapsed on them. La Taupe turns back, considering his options. He drops to knees, and digs around furiously looking for something. T follow his eyes to find what’s freaking him out - THE SMA

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: What happened to the entrance? THE SMALL ENTRANCE IS GONE. There is no retreat. La Taupe stands and looks at them, very seriously. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) Are we dead? They all contemplate this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: No. Scarlett sees the fear rising in her group.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We should keep moving. She takes a deep breath and lunges underwater, pushing he way under the rock to the other side.  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett comes up on the other side. A mirror image of th rose chamber. The same tomb. THIS TIME WITH A ROTTEN CORP ATOP IT. Scarlett looks around nervously. The others join her, one at a time. George looks past Scarlett.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (calling out) Hello? She spins to find. A FIGURE STANDING AT THE FAR END OF THE ROOM. In the dark it’s hard to see more than a faint shape. George's voice echoes through the long chamber. No reaction. Nothing. They all look at each other, not sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you hear me? Nothing. The figure moves a little, muttering quietly to himself - like a man possessed.

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: (quiet) Maybe he knows a way out. (calling out) Do you know a way out? Nothing. The figure just keeps muttering to himself. Scarlett takes a step toward him. And another.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: We have to pass him. She's right. The hole that leads beyond is just behind th figure.  81. They inch forward.

dialogues.speaker: WRRRGAAAAHHH
dialogues.text: They all freeze as the figure moves, repetitious, erratic like someone with severe mental illness. The figure takes another step forward, stepping into the light:

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: Papillon?! Nothing. No reaction. Souxie moves to the front of the pack. Old friends with Papillon.

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Papillon. Et-tu bien? No reaction.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: How’d you get here? Nothing. Souxie moves closer. They all follow her.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Careful, Souxie. Souxie gets closer.

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE
dialogues.text: Et-tu bien, Papillon? As they get closer, they can hear pieces of what he’s muttering. He doesn’t seem to see any of them.

dialogues.speaker: SOUXIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Papillon. She inches closer and closer. She reaches out to touch hi shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: IN A FLASH, PAPILLON VICIOUSLY ATTACKS SOUXIE, CRASHING H
dialogues.text: RIGHT THROUGH THE CAMERA (which falls into the water, fra the rest of the incident from an odd angle) AND SLAMMING

dialogues.speaker: FEROCIOUSLY.
dialogues.text: EVERYONE RUSHES TO SOUXIE’S DEFENSE, fighting to rip Papi off her. PAPILLON FALLS AWAY INTO THE DARKNESS. Benji picks the camera up off the floor and spins it to t to cast light on Papillon.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Over there! Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’d he go?

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: What the fuck?! Scarlett tends to Souxie, who is unconscious and bleeding from the face and mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: We need to get her out of here! We need to get her help!

dialogues.speaker: LA TAUPE
dialogues.text: Papillon?! Everyone is shaken up.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Grab her legs!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. La Taupe lost his mask in the struggle, revealing TERRIBL BURN SCARS ON HALF HIS FACE. He helps George and Scarlett lift Souxie. They rush her to the small opening at the end of the cham exactly the same as the one behind the Ptolemaic hinged d

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Give me the rope.  83. Zed grabs the rope and hands it to Scarlett. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Tie her feet and lift her into the hole once I get through. Scarlett squeezes through, nothing but her feet visible t the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s tight in the tunnel with Scarlett. Her breathing lab and nervous. As she nears the end, she hears something in the next roo She stops. Listens. What is it? Someone’s voice? She’s scared, but this isn’t the place to stop. She climbs forw She approaches the end of the hole very slowly, worried a what she might find in the next room. She suddenly pushes her way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Splash! She falls out the other side into the water. She jumps to feet, and scans the room looking for anyone who might be there. She doesn’t see anyone. She looks at her arms. Blood? She dips her hand in the wa looks at it. Dark red. She looks around the room again.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Okay. Send Souxie.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I’m coming first. So I can help pull. George climbs through. He drops into the water beside Scarlett. He too notes the “water.”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this blood?  84.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I don’t know. George tastes the liquid off his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It tastes like blood. I think...

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: (very serious) Let's just keep going.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. George and Scarlett pull Souxie through the tunnel while keeping an eye behind themselves, just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all rush onward, sticking close together, on edge. They arrive at a hole in the ground. Much like the one th descended earlier.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Great. Everything is the mirror image of what we’ve already done, but somehow it keeps going deeper.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: How deep will this take us? Zed finishes lowering his rope. He does the math in his h

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Another 100 meters.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Making it... 1000 feet beneath the earth’s surface. That’s pretty deep.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Deeper than the Eiffel Tower is high.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I get it.  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett and George get to the bottom. Look left to find bone chamber. Scarlett steps back into the chimney and helps spot the lowering of Souxie. Only Benji remains above.

dialogues.speaker: FAINT VOICE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Scarlett?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Do you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FAINT VOICE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Scarlett?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Is that Benji?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: (shaken) I don’t think so. Scarlett steps into the chimney. Calls to Benji. SCARLETT (CONT’D) You okay up there Benji?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benji kneels, alone up top, tense, lowering Souxie down. camera sits on the ground beside him, cropping him strang Is something moving in the shadows behind him? He hears a faint cry. A baby? He uses the camera’s onboard light to look around. Nothin He lowers Souxie down a little further. Scarlett calls up him.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: You okay? He hears something. Is someone lurking in the shadows?

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Is someone up here?  86. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Benji? You okay? He hears else. Looks. Nothing. He calls down to Scarlett.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Yeah. He hears something directly behind him and spins to find:

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aah! Benji jumps away from her, dropping the line and slipping the edge of the chute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Souxie drops the last ten feet, landing with a thud.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Oh! Benji, you just...

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: They all spin to find BENJI BEHIND THEM, DEAD FROM A FALL DOWN THE CHIMNEY CHUTE. They look up the chimney chute. Is someone looking down a them? George checks Benji’s vitals. Shakes his head. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What just happened?!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Scarlett bends down and strokes Benji’s hair tenderly. SCARLETT (CONT’D) I’m so sorry, Benji.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: We should keep moving. George snaps to.  87.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hand me the camera. We might need the onboard light. Zed grabs it, hands it to George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shuffle over the bones in the chamber as fast as the can, each struggling against the fear of getting trapped here. George sees something under the bones. He shines a light it to get a better look. Underneath the bones is a gutter full of water, in which YOUNG MAN, struggles to get to the surface of the water t breathe.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Danny! Danny! The Young Man pushes against the bones, but George’s weig on top of them makes it impossible for the Young Man to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get off the bones! He’s drowning down there! Everyone get off the bones! The Young Man seems to keep pace with George as he desperately tries to get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: This is tapping a deep nerve in George. He gets to the end of the bone chamber and checks back to find the Young Man gone. George covers his mouth and takes a few beats. Scarlett approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was so real.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Why... Why would... he be here?  88.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: It’s not him. I think this place knows our pain and is using it against us. In the distance, SOMEONE SCREAMS MERCILESSLY - and not th kind of scream you hear in movies, the kind you hear in a at 4 in the morning. They all move very close together, getting more and more unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screams become more and more present as the gang approaches. Seems like it’s coming from mushroom alley. The light in the corridor looks different too. As if lit firelight. They turn the corner to find:

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: La Taupe obviously knows what this is.

dialogues.speaker: N'ETAIT PAS MON DEFAUT
dialogues.text: La Taupe races to the car, trying to help the people. Scarlett and George try to pull him away.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: IN A FLASH, the BURNING MAN catches hold of one of La Tau legs. La Taupe struggles against the man, losing his shoe socks, pants in the struggle. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) Help me! Help me! George and Scarlett grab La Taupe’s arms and try to pull free, but it’s no use.  89. CRACK! The ground beneath the car seems to be cracking.

dialogues.speaker: GRABS LA TAUPE BY THE HAIR.
dialogues.text: The ground swallows up the burning car and La Taupe, but ground closes at La Taupe’s knees, leaving La Taupe’s low legs sticking out of the ground, flailing in pain as the sounds of his singeing flesh and agonized screams below. Everyone rushes to his side, trying in vain to pull him b out of the ground. His flesh burns them to the touch. George nudges Scarlett, points. A figure hovers in the shadows at the edge of the corridor they came from. They hurry through the room, to the next hallway. Scarlett hears something.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Music. Sure enough. They hear music in the next room. Similar to electronic music the ravers played earlier.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: They might know a way out. Scarlett leads George and Zed (who still carry Souxie) in the music to find:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cataphile party, but it’s very different now. Through strobing lights, the ravers seem to scream inaudibly, writhing in pain, while BRUTALLY DEVOURING EACH OTHER. The music is different too. It’s full of cattle screams, grinding cacophonous noises, awful. Our gang turns off all lights and hustles through the hel sight as fast as they can. Suddenly, THE ONBOARD LIGHT ON THE CAMERA FLIPS ON,

dialogues.speaker: ILLUMINATING THE RAVERS AND THEY ARE ALL FUCKED UP
dialogues.text: BLEEDING, MOUTHS SCREAMING. Horrific. The camera shakes. George spins around to find a raver desperately trying to take refuge behind him. George push away from the raver, as another one grabs him.  90. George hits him with the lens of the camera, but the rave keep coming. In the struggle, George loses his grip on Souxie.

dialogues.speaker: SECONDS, DEVOURING HER RAVENOUSLY.
dialogues.text: George jumps back from the mayhem, but loses his footing. A Raver drops onto George, trying viciously to rip into h George fights like mad to keep the Raver at bay, and even gets back to his feet as: ANOTHER RAVER RIPS A HUGE BITE OUT OF GEORGE’S NECK, shoo blood into the air. George drops to his knees, bleeding uncontrollably. Scarlett and Zed grab George’s arms and pull him into the next room. In the confusion, Benji’s camera strap has twi around George’s arm. The camera slides with them as he’s pulled into the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cinema’s screen now shows a “remixed” version of the silent film “Haxan - Witchcraft Through the Ages.” It’s bizarre, upsetting, creepy. Scarlett tries desperately to stop George’s bleeding neck

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: No! No! Nothing is working. SCARLETT (CONT’D) (to Zed) Come here! Put your hand here! Keep pressure! She rips into her bag. Pulls out the Philosopher’s Stone. She crumbles some of it off, rubs it into his wound. Watches. Nothing. SCARLETT (CONT’D) It doesn't work?! George mutters something.  She She She She Zed She She gl. SCARLETT (CONT’D) What? What was that?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (barely audible) “VITRIOL.”

dialogues.speaker: VITRIOL
dialogues.text: gets it.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “Visit the Interior Parts of the Earth; by Rectification Thou Shalt Find the Hidden Stone." looks at George.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This isn’t the right stone. I have to rectify the taking of it. Only through putting it back will I find the real hidden stone. stands, looks around the dark, creepy chamber. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Oh fuck. contemplates it. SCARLETT (CONT’D) I’m going back. thinks he’s surely not understanding this right.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: We must keep moving forward.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: We’re more than half a mile underground. By the time you and I lift him out of here, he’1l be dead. looks over her gear, preparing herself. SCARLETT (CONT’D) And I’m not going to let that happen. runs back toward the rave room.  92. Note: The following sequence of Scarlett on her own will filmed only by the GoPro camera on her head. We will see arms and legs, hear her vocal and breathing reactions, bu won’t see her face. Instead, we'll experience the followi as she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett rushes into the room. The same music, the same lights. But this time there’s only one person there, danc alone amongst all the devoured flesh. Wearing a bull mask The bull mask moves, but doesn’t seem to be looking direc at her. She races to the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett races through Mushroom Alley, nothing left but a small smouldering hole where La Taupe was swallowed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE at the other end of the corridor stops Scarlett her tracks. Doesn’t look like Papillon. Older, heavier. A VOICE behind her.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Scarlett?! She spins around to find: HER FATHER RIGHT BEHIND HER! But something’s wrong with h His legs are like tree trunks grown into the floor. His a like brittle twigs with blood dripping off them. She jumps away from the sight...

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Dad?! And bumps into something behind her. She spins to find:

dialogues.speaker: HER FATHER THERE TOO
dialogues.text: Her bumping him has broken off one of his twigs, causing to howl in pain. SCARLETT’S FATHER No! What have you done?!  93.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: What do you... She backs away from the sight, again bumping into somethi behind her. Her father is there too. SCARLETT’S FATHER You look just like my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: It is me dad. SCARLETT’S FATHER No! You’re not her! She would never come here! Scarlett bumps something else, turns, her father is there too. SCARLETT’S FATHER (CONT’D) She would know. If she ever came here, there would be no way out. She’d be trapped here. Forever! She runs from the room, choking back sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she crosses the threshold into the next room, she bump into her father here too. SCARLETT’S FATHER Forever! Forever! Forever! Forever! His voice takes on a shrill screeching quality. Like a ba dream in which a loved one suddenly seems possessed. She keeps moving, but this place is really taking a toll her. Scarlett shuttles over the bones in the bone tunnel. Again, she sees her Father, in this room too. The multipl voices of her Father doubling, tripling, into a cacophony agony. SCARLETT’S FATHER (CONT’D) Ever! Ever! Ever! She clears the bones, and rushes into the next alcove nea the chimney chute, SOBBING AS SHE GOES. This is the lonel moment of her life.  94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her father continues to squall in the background as she m her way to the chimney chute. She can’t reach the opening well enough to get footing. She kicks off her shoes to get better traction, takes a running start, jumps up and grabs hold of the rock wall. struggles to make her way up the first couple feet. As she gets some height in the chimney chute without rope protect her, one false move would send her plummeting to death. Her foot slips and she almost drops. She takes a couple d breaths.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You can do this. Don’t think. Just keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett gets to the top of the chimney chute, but gettin out of the circular hole isn’t easy. She has to carefully position herself as she inches herself to solid ground be the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes through the bloody water as fast as she can, trying to make up for lost time in the chimney chute. AN ARM REACHES UP FROM UNDER THE WATER AND GRABS HER LEG. She jumps at the feeling and pulls against it. Another ar Another. Arms reach up and grab her from every direction, pulling her under the bloody water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett fights against the arms pulling her every which She plants a foot on a stone ledge and pushes with all he might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett breaks through, now covered head to toe in blood She rips her way free of the grabbing arms.  95. She catches her breath, overwhelmed, freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett rushes through the small tight tunnel leading to Rose Chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett lands in the Rose Tunnel, looks around, all safe She hurries through.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Ow! She looks down at her feet, illuminating:

dialogues.speaker: HORRIFIED, WATCHING HER
dialogues.text: Other heads have nothing but their mouths showing and the try to bite anything passing. She does her best to avoid the faces, but sustains a seri of bites on the way, drawing blood. She dives into the water at the end to swim back into the alchemy chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett enters the Alchemist Chamber. What once looked s opulent and breathtaking in its beauty, now looks evil, depressing, lonely.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: “By Rectification Thou Shalt Find the Hidden Stone." She pulls the rock out as she scours the Egyptian images, looking for the eye of Ra she originally took the stone f She finds the eye. Lifts the stone. Too high. She slides rock into place and stands on it. She lifts the stone tow the eye of Ra. It clicks right into place. A perfect fit.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, I’ve rectified. Now, where's...  96. The stone in its place, she drops her eyes, to find a mir right in front of her face. SCARLETT (CONT’D) -.. the hidden stone. Thoughts play across her face. She understands something hadn’t before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Zed in the cinema. A GROUP OF 5 FIGURES ENTER FROM THE FAR END OF THE ROOM. quickly flips the camera’s onboard light off, dropping th room into near darkness, except for the projected images the silent movie. THE FIGURES MOVE AS IF IN SLOW MOTION, IRREGULAR, SILENT.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (quiet) Shhh. George desperately tries to keep quiet despite his neck wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett races through the rose chamber where the rotting corpse’s body has been restored to it’s un-decayed state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Zed hide. The Figures seem not to have noticed them. The camera lies right behind Zed and George just catching piece of the passing Figures, which makes the anticipatio almost unbearable. The Figures stop as they get close. One of them slowly tu his head, LOOKS RIGHT AT ZED AND GEORGE.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett plants her feet and descends the Chimney Chute a fast as she can. She is focused, driven. She hits the ground at the bottom and runs for the bone chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Figures move closer and closer - still in their bizar slow motion - to George and Zed.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (quiet, to Zed) Go. Zed thinks about it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: No. Right as the figures are about to grab onto them, Zed gra George under the arms and pulls him furiously toward the room. The Figures stop. One turns his head to look at them. The pivot, and keep following, in slightly quicker motion. Th Figures move slowly but consistently toward Zed and Georg Zed pulls George as fast and vigorously as he can, but th Figures are gaining on him. Scarlett sprints right around the Figures as Zed pulls Ge into the adjacent corridor. As Scarlett passes them, one the Figures reaches out in fast motion, trying to grab he but she dodges him just in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett grabs George’s other arm and helps Zed create a little distance from the Figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett races to George’s side. He’s unconscious. In bad shape.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Did you find the stone?  98.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Yes. Scarlett stops in the middle of the corridor. Zed drops t camera to the ground beside them, flips the light on so Scarlett can see. The scene is framed irregularly, Scarle and George’s heads cropped strangely. SHE PLACES HER HANDS OVER GEORGE’S WOUNDS. KISSES HIM DEE He comes to, coughs up blood. She moves her hands away fr his wound to find his wounds gone.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: How did you do that?!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I am the stone. As are you. As we all are. As above, so below. The Figures are getting closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Scarlett! She looks, sees them coming nearer and nearer. George reg consciousness. He touches his wounds to find himself heal Scarlett and Zed help George to his feet. The three of th run from the room as the Figures approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race into the Artist Alcove. The camera's onboard light (their last remaining light) fritzes out, then comes back on. They look around the room to find it a dead end. There is however, a large hole in the middle of the floor.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Dead end!

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: No! Zed looks to the hole. He takes a rock and drops it into hole. It goes and goes and goes, seemingly never hitting ground.  99.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: We'll never be able to climb down that. The onboard camera light goes out.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: No! No! We’re so close!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: There were paintings on the wall. Did you see them?

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: No. I was looking for an exit.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I have matches.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You do? Zed digs through his pockets. Counts them.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: Light one. Zed lights one. It flashes and goes out revealing the FIG NOW IN THE ROOM, APPROACHING. SCARLETT (CONT’D) I couldn't see it! Light another one!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Don’t let it go out so fast. Zed lights another match. Scarlett scans the room for anything that could give a clue. The Figures are getting closer! She sees Egyptian hieroglyphic paintings on one w as the match goes out. The match goes out.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I found something. I didn’t have a chance to really see it though. Light the next one! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: This is the last one.  100.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: I know! Go! He lights the match. This time she gets a quick look at t painting. The painting shows the Ancient Egyptian demon, AMMUT - pa lion, hippopotamus and crocodile - the “soul eater.” Behi him looks like one part of a scale, with a feather on it. painted beam from that scale rises up to the ceiling, and across above them, and seems to end right over the hole. The match goes out. SCARLETT (CONT’D) (very quickly) The “soul eater.” In Egyptian mythology, after you died, you went to the underworld where your heart was weighed against a feather. If your heart weighted more than a feather, the soul eater, would eat your heart and you were condemned to nothingness. The camera flickers for a moment. She uses the light to m her way to the hole. SCARLETT (CONT’D) We need to make our souls lighter than a feather. And then we jump.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: We what?! The camera flickers, the Figures are now very close.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: What is the thing that weighs your soul down? The thing you’ve never told anyone?! She goes first. SCARLETT (CONT’D) The night my dad killed himself. He called me and I didn’t answer. The pain of this taps a real nerve in her.  101.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wasn’t doing anything important. I just didn’t feel like talking to him. When I think of what he must have been feeling... George takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: When I went to get help for my brother, I panicked and forgot to remember how to get back to him. And he died because of it. Scarlett nods gently to him. They look to Zed.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I was in a car that ran a man over. I never reported it. Scarlett takes Zed’s hand too. The camera light flickers. THE FIGURES ARE RIGHT THERE, SECONDS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: On three.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: This isn’t going to work.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: You don’t have to believe in it, George. But if you take the jump, it’1l work. He nods. The three of them join hands. SCARLETT (CONT’D) One... two... THREE! They step into the abyss together and fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera rattles around, banging off the walls as they fall, screaming through the nothingness. It just seems to go on and on. Falling and falling.  102.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: They hit a rock wall, and fall to the ground beside the h They look around to find paintings and graffiti like that found near the surface. George smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: We're not dead.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: It worked?! There, above them is a ladder leading up to a manhole cov on the surface. They scurry up the ladder, excited by the idea of getting of this place, open the manhole cover slowly to find:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris. Scarlett and George and Zed step out onto the Parisian ci street, surrounded by cafes and revelers, partying and celebrating life.

dialogues.speaker: SCARLETT
dialogues.text: It worked. The three of them embrace.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: See ya around, Zed. Zed watches on as George and Scarlett walk off into the Parisian night, holding each other close, surrounded by Parisians blissfully unaware of the hell that lies beneat their feet.
